reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: In Somaliland the possibilities for different livelihoods are limited. Especially unemployment of the youth is a serious problem. The purpose of the project was the empowerment of young women and men in Burao and Erigavo through employment promotion activi ties and vocational training skills. The project was implemented from 2010 to 2013 and it was part of ten years cooperation between ISF and implementing partner Candlelight for Health, Environment and Education (CLHE) on vocational training. During the pro ject youth got training in different skills and in the end of the project 36,8 % of trained youth got employment or started own business. In addition, the small business owners of both male and female were trained on effective small business management pra ctices including financial management and in the end of the project 80,3 % trained business owners used double-entry bookkeeping system. Also 1049 women learned to read and write during the project. Totally the project benefitted directly 3772 persons from whom 2756 (73 %) were women.
